State. It is the nearest transportation hub for the Tibetan settlement of

value: Bengaluru city to Kushal Nagar via Mysore is 223Km and its over 4 hours drive.
Mysore to Kushal Nagar 87Km and its over 90 minutes drive.
Mangalore to Kushal Nagar via Puttur, Sulya is 168Km and its over 3 hours drive.
Other modes of transportation also available such as KSRTC & Private buses which runs all day. One can hire a Taxi or Travel cab from Bengaluru city, Mysore & Mangalore too.

Government buses and Private buses are available to reach nearer tourist places with in Coorg district like Madikeri, Somwarpet.
It is also easy to hire a local taxi or cab. Train, Plane or By sea transport are not available to and from this town.

value: Harangi Reservoir Harangi - This Reservoir is located in Hudgur village near Kushalnagar. Harangi Dam is around 6 kms from Kushalnagar town.
Valnoor Fishing Camp - Valnoor Fishing Camp Valnoor is situated just near Dubare.

Chiklihole Dam - Chicklihole Dam in Coorg near Suntikoppa Chiklihole reservoir in Coorg is located in between Madikeri and Kushalnagar and is roughly around 15 kms from Kushalnagar & Madikeri and itâ€™s near to Dubare.

Dubare - Dubare Forest Reserve Dubare Elephant Camp Dubare is an elephant capturing and training camp of the Forest Department of Coorg. Dubare is located in between Kushalnagar and Siddapur on the banks of river Kaveri
Tibetan Monastery - Tibetan Golden Temple in Coorg The Tibetan Monastery or the Tibet Camp as locally called is located around 6 kms from Kushalnagar town towards Mysore.

Nisargadhama - Cauvery Nisargadhama Nisargadhama is a forest resort in Coorg just 3kms from Kushalnagar towards Madikeri off the state highway. Nisargadhama is a 25 acre island formed by river Kaveri with bamboos, teak, sandalwood trees streams and wild life covering it.

Madikeri, Virajpete & Somwarpet are other major towns in Coorg District. These towns are little far from Kushal Nagar which connects to other tourist places.
Visit Cauvery Nisargadhama early in the morning. There is a hanging bridge over the river. The place is too good in the snow.

value: Horse & Elephant riding at Cauvery Nisargadhama.
Play in the river (watch for careful sings & boards by Govt. though).

Around Kushalnagar and close to Nisargadhama island, tourists could buy below:

value: Wooden made wall clocks, kitchen items, kids toys & many Chinese made items can also be purchased.
Green tea, Coffee tea and many other.

where you can eat delicious momos.

Home made chocolates are commonly found in shops.

Kushal nagar has many hotels & resorts to stay varying from low to high cost. As this is a holiday destination and attractive hill station, it is preferred to book hotel or resort in advance. Direct arrival and finding a comfort room might not be advisable. 

There are few resorts who offer just accommodation with basic amenities while food will be optional and chargeable. And there are expensive resorts who offer everything including food, accommodation & activities. 

Usually these are kind of holiday destinations where hotel rooms and resorts consider two seasons. Off season (Winter) and Season (Summer holidays). So the charges might slightly vary.
Madikeri is at the tip of Coorg district than all other towns. Making Madikeri town as central point, tourist can visit to:

value: Tala Cauvery (Birth location of Cauvery river)
